![image](dreieck.eps)\

In a triangle, having the sides $a$, $b$ and $c$ opposite to the angles
$\alpha$, $\beta$ and $\gamma$ respectively the following equations
hold:
$$(a+b)\sin \frac{\gamma}{2}=c\cos\left(\frac{\alpha -\beta}{2}\right)$$
and
$$(a-b)\cos\frac{\gamma}{2}=c\sin\left(\frac{\alpha -\beta}{2}\right).$$
